title: PDF Table Extractor for Invoices
description: A Streamlit App to create sortable invoices.
longDescription1: This app was inspired by the many hours I've spent sorting through invoices at work. When receiving inventory, I often need to search through line items to verify pricing and other details. For short or well-organized invoices, this is easy enough, but when invoices span multiple pages or aren't sorted by product number, the process becomes time-consuming and error-prone.
longDescription2: I initially tried to build a PDF table reader in JavaScript within my portfolio project, but it didn't provide the flexibility I needed. I switched to Python, using PDF Plumber to extract table data and Pandas to structure it into a dataframe, which I then displayed using Streamlit for an interactive web interface.
longDescription3: Version G is the first completed iteration of this project. It identifies and extracts the main tables from a specific vendor's invoice format, merges tables from multiple pages, and outputs a complete, sortable table. Users can also download the results as a CSV file for further analysis.
longDescription4: The next phase of the project is to build a more generalized version that allows users to customize table parsing and create templates for different invoice formats - making the tool adaptable across various document structures and vendors.
